citations.narrative:
This inspection occurred at approximately 1:30 pm on July 26th. At that time, the outside temperature was approximately
98 F. The temperature inside the rabbit barn was 86 F with all the air conditioners running. The maximum temperature for
July 26th went to 101 F so the maximum temperature inside the barn likely went above 86 F. At temperatures over 85 F
rabbits are at risk for hyperthermia.
At the time of inspection, the rabbits appeared warm but not in distress.
Indoor housing facilities for rabbits shall be adequately ventilated to provide for the health and comfort of the animals at all
times. Adequate ventilation means maintaining the temperature at a comfortable level and ensuring fresh air is circulated
through the barn to prevent odors.
The facility needs to ensure the barn is adequately ventilated at all times.
To be corrected by: Aug 14, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.51(b) 
   
Facilities, indoor. 
This inspection occurred at approximately 1:30 pm on July 26th. At that time, the outside temperature was approximately 
98 F. The temperature inside the rabbit barn was 86 F with all the air conditioners running. The maximum temperature for 
July 26th went to 101 F so the maximum temperature inside the barn likely went above 86 F. At temperatures over 85 F 
rabbits are at risk for hyperthermia.  
At the time of inspection, the rabbits appeared warm but not in distress.  
Indoor housing facilities for rabbits shall be adequately ventilated to provide for the health and comfort of the animals at all 
times. Adequate ventilation means maintaining the temperature at a comfortable level and ensuring fresh air is circulated 
through the barn to prevent odors.  
The facility needs to ensure the barn is adequately ventilated at all times. 
To be corrected by: Aug 14, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
